page.title: 09CHURCHES IN CHILMARK/TEFFONT
page.content: The{Church of St Margaret of Antioch, {Chilmark}is a handsome cruciform{Early {English}building with an earlier door way. The northern side of the building including the aisle arcade was added in{1856.}The congregation averages 25. The parish is part of the{Tisbury team ministry. The roof will have to be rebuilt in the near future, at a cost of at least Â£15,000. The church spire can be seen from a long way away when approaching the village from any direction. {St Edwards, Teffont Magna,}has{Saxon features, and a nave and chancel in one. The congregation of about two dozen has difficulty in maintaining the fabric. The parish is now combined with{Dinton and Barford St Martin}to the east. The Reading Room, a First World War memorial, belongs to the church and is now used as a store.
